chapter_title: Meteorological Information for Aircraft in Flight

questions.question:
An aerodrome VOLMET report for 0450 UTC, during the autumn in the United Kingdom is:
Surface wind 150/05 kt
Visibility 2000 m
Weather Nil
Temperature $9^{\circ}C$
Dew point $8^{\circ}C$
QNH 1029 hPa
Trend NOSIG
From the information above, what type of pressure system, do you deduce, is dominating the region?
A VOLMET is defined as:
options: a. a radio broadcast of selected aerodrome forecasts
b. a continuous telephone message of selected aerodrome METARS
c. a continuous radio broadcast of selected aerodrome actual weather observations and forecasts
d. a teleprinter message of selected aerodrome TAFs and METARS

questions.question: VOLMETs are:
options: a. air to ground radio transmissions on HF and VHF
b. air to ground radio transmissions on HF and SVHF
c. ground to air radio transmissions on LF and VHF
d. ground to air radio transmissions on HF and VHF

questions.question:

When are ATIS broadcasts updated?
options: a. Any time the aerodrome or weather information changes
b. Only when the aerodrome information changes

questions.question: To minimize VHF frequency use, the ATIS can be broadcast on the voice frequency of which navigation aid?
In an ATIS broadcast, what is used to identify the current report?
What is the ATIS?
options: a. A chart of current aerodrome and weather information
b. A continuous broadcast of current aerodrome and weather information
c. A continuous broadcast of weather information
d. A printed text report of current aerodrome and weather information

questions.question: In what frequency band is the ATIS normally broadcast?
